title.narrative: DISASTER RISK REDUCTION

description.narrative: Government, partners and UNICEF staff have the capacities and technical resources to strengthen the resilience of children, communities and development systems to natural hazards, climate change and civil strife, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: India Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government, partners and UNICEF staff have the capacities and technical resources to strengthen the resilience of children,communities and development systems to natural hazards, climate change and civil strife

description.narrative: The overlapping COVID-19 second wave crisis compounded by multiple hydro-meteorological hazards had critical impact on the health and humanitarian situation and needs across states stretching the capacities of government and humanitarian organizations to respond. ;UNICEF prioritized ;strengthening systemic preparedness and response capabilities of the key departments of the government, front-line workers, and partner platforms to ensure social sector services continue to deliver uninterrupted, ;inclusive, gender and child-sensitive humanitarian action. UNICEF India and its partners across the country assisted the government and its key departments to deliver results for a targeted 664 million vulnerable population and 286 million | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2022
